title: New Message Button Does Not Work On TB v.140.0.1esr Local Folders
creator: bigcat21
content:
[I am starting a new post because I was replying to someone else's post and it stopped working.]

After updating to TB v.140.0esr (then just now updating to v.140.0.1esr) from v.128esr, I cannot compose a new message in any Local Folders or my main virtual inbox. The +New Message button is there, but clicking it does nothing. It was working for over a decade before this.

However, going into the normal account folder inboxes DOES allow me to click the "+New Message" button and start/compose a new message.

I can still reply to messages in the local and virtual folders, just not start a new message.

I have tried disabling all security software. No luck.

I have ran Help > Troubleshoot mode with no addons. No luck.

When I create a new folder under Local Folders, clicking New Message still does nothing while in that new folder. But if I move that new folder to an existing email account, then go to the new folder, clicking New Message works correctly.

I am on Windows 10. I did use the addon Manually Sort Folders in the past, but not recently.

I ran the Check Error Console (ctrl+shift+J) on TB v.140.0esr. Here is the paste:

1752107893534 addons.xpi WARN Checking C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird\distribution\extensions for addons This page is in Quirks Mode. Page layout may be impacted. For Standards Mode use ‚Äú‚Äù. background.html WebExtensions: Import modules with new 'ChromeUtils.importESModule' implementation.js:34 Hello there, I'm BorderColors-D! background.js:11:9 CopySent2Current: 3.39 on Thunderbird 140.0 Received: pong

1.0.9 background.js:141:33 no migration CardBookXULNotifyListener.js:600:13 TypeError: can't access property "document", currentWindow is null implementation.js:568:15 1752107894980 addons.webextension.{a300a000-5e21-4ee0-a115-9ec8f4eaa92b} WARN Loading extension '{a300a000-5e21-4ee0-a115-9ec8f4eaa92b}': Reading manifest: Warning processing locales: An unexpected property was found in the WebExtension manifest. 1752107894980 addons.webextension.{a300a000-5e21-4ee0-a115-9ec8f4eaa92b} WARN Loading extension '{a300a000-5e21-4ee0-a115-9ec8f4eaa92b}': Reading manifest: Warning processing chrome_injectors: An unexpected property was found in the WebExtension manifest. title: Recovering from HDD crash, looking for Thunderbird SENT emails
creator: tchen002
content:
I'm recovering from a HDD crash that damaged the boot sector only, my files were unharmed. I am/was using Thunderbird. My Roadrunner IN BOUND e-mails were saved on the Roadrunner servers and successfully downloaded to the new Thunderbird client installed on my new hard drive. But none of my SENT e-mails were stored by Roadrunner.

I want to find my old HDD file of SENT e-mails only and move it to my new drive so they'll load in my new Thunderbird. Roadrunner support said they should be on my old HDD but because my old Thunderbird settings were in POP while my new Thunderbird is in IMAP, the file may not be compatible. Of course they gave me incorrect settings also, so not sure if that's accurate.

Regardless, even if incompatible, I want to have some way to access my old sent e-mails for tax and other purposes.

Please help!

Thanks Theo
metadata: ;solver_id:6864223;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/138.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/138.0.0.0;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data"]

title: Text Menus in Tbird 140
creator: Jaws13
content:
This happens about every three or four major updates: After the programmers monkey with the interface, part of my personalizations disappear. This time, it's the text menus at the top of the screen. (And it's two computers since the last time I had a solution to this.)

The "menu hamburger" is not sufficient for touch-typists. I want the icons off to the right of the text menus, on the same line, the way it's been possible to establish since Tbird was in the low-30s for version numbers. Instead, the update refused to respect my personalizations, and hid the menu bar completely and makes it impossible to combine with the icons. I dimly recall that there was an about:config solution to this in earlier versions, but can't remember or find it (or confirm it would work with Eclipse).
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:140.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/140.0

title: Trying to recover lost emails.
creator: kjinnovation
content:
I have an email account with BlueHost, which also hosts my web domain. A couple weeks ago I stopped receiving emails and contacted BlueHost tech support. The agent had no clue why I wasn't receiving email. She said "Can you please click on acocunt actions and remove the account and re-addd it. [sic]" I did that, and I was again able to receive emails. But then all my old emails -- sent and received -- had disappeared. BlueHost was able to restore my Inbox emails back to May 19, but was not able to recover any Sent emails. I have a backup of my Thunderbird directory from April, but would like to recover all of my old emails, which apparently still exist because my current Thunderbird Profiles directory contains files corresponding to deleted email folders. For example, my Inbox had a subfolder -- call it ABC -- that was deleted and is no longer visible in my Inbox, but I can find files ABC (no extension) and ABC.msf in my Inbox.sbd folder. My Sent.sbd folder also contains files ABC and ABC.msf. These folders are in C:\Users\aaa\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\aaa.default\Mail\mail.aaa.com (with "aaa" representing my personal identifiers). mail.aaa.com contains files Inbox, Inbox.msf, Sent, and Sent.msf, which seem to contain my old emails. (Inbox is 132,151 KB and Sent is 289,829 KB, and the file dates are from a couple weeks ago, when I removed and re-added the email account.)

Is there a way that I can recover the old emails?
metadata: ;solver_id:6864597;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:140.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/140.0

title: email segnalate da me come "NON INDESIDERATA" vengono ricatalogate come INDESIDERATA (spam)
creator: maurizio.andrenacci
content:
Gentilissimi, come da oggetto Thunderbird segna come spam alcune email certamente sicure, di conseguenza eseguo tasto destro sopra l'email buona e seleziono "SEGNA COME NON INDESIDERATA". Thunderbird parte con l'intento di spostarla in "posta in arrivo" rimanendo bloccato per qualche secondo ma poi la vedo ritornare nella cartella "INDESIDERATA". Pertanto le email segnalate da me come "NON INDESIDERATE" vengono ricatalogate come "INDESIDERATE (spam)" e non riesco a capire come fare per istruire Thunderbird a non sbagliare nuovamente.

Ho anche tentato di dare il comando "sposta in posta in arrivo" ma ugualmente viene rispostata in INDESIDERATA.

Qualcuno mi pu√≤ aiutare? Grazie

English version Dear Sirs, as per the subject Thunderbird marks as spam some emails that are certainly safe, consequently I execute right click on the good email and select "MARK AS UNWANTED". Thunderbird starts with the intention of moving it to "inbox" getting stuck for a few seconds but then I see it return to the "UNWANTED" folder. As a result, emails that I flagged as 'UNIDENTIFIED' are being re-catalogued as 'UNIDENTIFIED (spam)' and I can't figure out how to instruct Thunderbird not to get it wrong again.

I've also tried to give the command "move to inbox" but it still gets bounced back to INDESIDERATE.

Can anyone help me? Thank you
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/138.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

content:

When I set the copies and folders setting to place a copy of all sent messages to my email address (IMAP server as i undersand it) it looks fine, but when I actaully send a message andthen look back at the setting it has changed to 'local folders' so the copy is only on the local laptop not accesible elswhere.

This isn't a problem wih an old version of Thunderbird: 102.13.1 (on an old laptop) but on 140.0.1 on a newer machine the problem is there...

Thanks John

title: After update July 25, the Outlook accounts fail to open. Says something about cookies not enabled on browser.
creator: generic111170
content: Windows 11 64bit. I have Outlook and Gmail accounts. About 6 months ago the Outlook accounts stopped sending messages. Ok, I can live with that as I only use them sparingly. I tried lots of tweaks from this forum but none worked. I am not technically minded so I may have interpereted the wrongly. After the last update 9/10 July 25, the Outlook accounts fail to open. Says something about cookies not enabled on browser. I added the logins to the exceptions but no change. The cookies show on the list as on the PC. So I can't use Outlook anymore. Gmail. Now I can't send any messages from Gmail accounts. Just waits ages and says try again. The email I was replying to disappeared from my inbox when I logged through Google Gmail account. It shows on Thunderbird. I also tried to set up a new Gmail account on Thunderbird, would let me. So now, Thunderbird is useless to me. Shame, I liked it and even donated. How could something go from good to useless in one update?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:140.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/140.0

title: Unable to change Thunderbird default font size
creator: bbharland
content:
I have followed the instructions provided here: https://support.mozilla.org/tn/questions/1397110

1. Keep settings in Settings>Composition at default (medium) 2. In Settings>General>Fonts & Colors>Advanced, change Latin Proportional and Monospace to 22 3. In Settings>General>Fonts & Colors>Advanced, change Other Writing Systems Proportional and Monospace to 22

The fonts in my messages are still tiny. What is the 2025 solution please?

Thank you!

title: Thunderbird Profile
creator: marygaydersh
content:
I shut down my computer on July 6th, went to bed, woke up on July 7th, opened my email to find all of my emails are gone. I had my daughter try and help and the app asked to set up an account. I (grandson) can find the profile and when I dig deeper in Mail I see 4 different inbox folders.

How do I get it to read the older inbox folders?

I have backed up the profile and deleted folder -3.net to try and get it to read the -2.net folder, it just recreates the -3.net folder and the emails only go back to 6/13/25. When I read the other .msf file in notepad I can see the archived emails dating back to 2020-2017. Even found the other folders that were under inbox.
